job_title: Personal Support Worker in Ottawa, ON
pros: Carefor always has lots of work to offer. I have worked with Carefor 10+ years. Any issue I have had management has been willing to sit down and resolve the issue. Carefor is fair to the employees when working out change of availability and hours. They have worked with me to accomodate what would keep me happy. Benefits are great and pension is a great bonus. One of the highest paying agencies.
cons: Traveling in the winter and poor weather conditions is difficult. Any job where you travel for work would be the same.

job_title: Personal Support Supervisor in Ottawa, ON
pros: People genuinely work towards the same goal. Continuously trying to improve work life balance and wellness in employees. Decent salary and good benefits. Highly recommend working in the personal support, nursing and or allied health department as they have support leaders.
cons: Lacks organization and communication between departments. High staff turn over. Staff shortage makes it challenging to support all department needs, resulting to complete tasks outside your job description.j

pros: Autonomy and full scope of practice
cons: Poor Support by upper management

pros: Working in the community,working independently.
cons: Rotation shift work, no respect from managers, no paid breaks.

pros: Flexibility of working remotely from home
cons: Supervisor is unfair, he reproached and terminated an employee because he wrote an exclamation mark in his email to HR/Manager, even though that Supervisor often sent email with exclamation mark to that employee. The employee was often finding the HR supervisor making errors and when he wrote an exclamation mark HR complained and the Supervisor just terminated the employee for that mark, it's really favoritism and unfairness.

pros: nothing is good, stay away!
cons: management is poor poor poor

pros:
- no shortage of work
- excellent benefits and pension for full time employees
- awesome coworkers and field staff
cons:
- CEO and upper management are grossly overpaid (sunshine list)
- 29 managers and supervisors at the Belfast office and all are Caucasian except one, which points to a systemic racism problem. 
- very top heavy, too many managers and Directors, and very understaffed for front-line workers
- terrible work environment and low morale
- managers are incapable of providing performance coaching
- poor training for new office staff
- bed bugs have been found in the office, infestations in the kitchen, and office staff believe they have contracted MRSA from unsanitary bathrooms. 
- no appreciation or positive encouragement for staff
- constant shortage of staff causes overwork and directly impacts client's care. 
- Many employees have felt they have been discriminated against and harassed by managers, inconsistent treatment of staff based on personal bias. 
- constant threats from management that the company will lose funding/contracts and everyone will lose their jobs
- very little opportunities for full time permanent positions, most positions are casual but require full time availability.

job_title: Rather Not Disclose in Ottawa, ON
pros: Benefits are ok. Pension is decent
cons:
poor culture, toxic environment, zero leadership. 

Managers and Senior staff have often been brought up from the workers, and given zero leadership training, or ineffective training at best. This translates into poor communications, accountability issues, and a division among staff. 

Having ethics is a challenge with some senior staff.

pros: I think Carefor is a great place to work. Lots of opportunity for growth. The agency truly cares about its staff and helping make them better.
cons: Transitioning to online and virtual has been slow, but it's getting better. Will make for a better org and better place to work.

pros: good group of employees in PSS
cons: Over worked, overtime never paid out ( must have approval before so if your stuck at the desk during your lunch or after work your not paid) . Turnover is so high the employees think that every time someone is approaching them they are going to get fired.

pros: Hourly pay is good and working in the community is a lighter load
cons: Not enough hours within the community you work and job wants you to pick up hours else where that is too far to commute to
